summary: This document consists of multiple 30-minute inmate check sheets from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated August 2, 2019. The logs record staff observations of inmates in continuous lockdown status, requiring checks at least twice per hour. The sheets are reviewed by lieutenants and a captain.

persons.name: Morning Watch Lieutenant
persons.context: The officer who reviewed the check sheets for the morning watch shift.

persons.name: Day Watch Lieutenant
persons.context: The officer in charge of the day watch shift, as indicated on the log headers.

persons.name: Evening Watch Lieutenant
persons.context: The officer in charge of the evening watch shift, as indicated on the log headers.

persons.name: Captain
persons.context: The senior officer who reviewed the check sheets, as noted at the bottom of each log.

events.title: Inmate Monitoring in MCC SHU
events.description: Routine 30-minute checks of inmates held in the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York were conducted throughout the day and night.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is a set of prison logs detailing 30-minute inmate checks in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York.
The logs are dated August 2, 2019, which is the day Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at MCC New York.
The logs cover multiple tiers (ZA, ZB, L, M, etc.) within the SHU, indicating a standard procedure for monitoring high-security or segregated inmates.
The procedure required staff to observe inmates at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule, with all observations documented.
The logs were reviewed by shift lieutenants and a captain, showing a chain of oversight for inmate monitoring.
